docs.lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, scientists have argued whether newer oral contraceptives cause certain types of blood clots more often than their predecessors.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reducing caffeine consumption during pregnancy from three cups of coffee a day to one has no effect on the baby’s birth weight, researchers report.

headline.main: Childbirth: Cutting Caffeine Not Found to Affect Birth Weight
headline.print_headline: Cutting Caffeine Not Found to Affect Birth Weight

docs.snippet: Reducing caffeine consumption during pregnancy from three cups of coffee a day to one has no effect on the baby’s birth weight, researchers report.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Elaine Sciolino writes for The Times this morning, fewer than 50 percent of the electorate turned out for a referendum on expanding and liberalizing Portugal's abortion law -- among the most restrictive in Europe -- but the sentiment among the 44 percent who did vote was clear: change the law, the they said.

headline.main: Portugal Vote on Abortion Doesn't Count; More Liberal Laws May Follow Anyway

docs.abstract: Referendum to legalize abortion in Portugal fails to get enough turnout, but the prime minister insists he'll make it happen anyway...
docs.snippet: Referendum to legalize abortion in Portugal fails to get enough turnout, but the prime minister insists he'll make it happen anyway...

docs.lead_paragraph: A referendum to liberalize the abortion law was approved, but turnout was too low for the result to be deemed valid.

headline.main: Low Turnout Undercuts Portugal Vote on Abortion
headline.print_headline: Low Turnout Undercuts Portugal Vote on Abortion Law

docs.snippet: A referendum to liberalize the abortion law was approved, but turnout was too low for the result to be deemed valid.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your Feb. 4 editorial ''Compassion for Rape Victims'' promotes a Connecticut bill that would force all hospitals to give ''emergency contraception'' to rape victims on request.
docs.abstract: US Conference of Catholic Bishops Secretariat for Pro-Life Activities planning and information director Deirdre A McQuade letter opposes February 4 editorial supporting Connecticut bill that would force all hospitals to give emergency contraception to rape victims on request
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Your Feb. 4 editorial ''Compassion for Rape Victims'' promotes a Connecticut bill that would force all hospitals to give ''emergency contraception'' to rape victims on request.
